content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 950.3 - Types of traffic excluded from use of the facilities

State Regulations
(a) Dangerous or unsafe
vehicles. Vehicles loaded in such a manner or with such materials or so
constructed or equipped as possibly to endanger persons or property or likely
to render the use of the bridges, plazas, yards, terminals, warehouses, or
buildings unsafe, are not allowed in or upon said areas or buildings. Without
limiting the foregoing the following types of vehicles are not allowed in or
upon said areas and buildings: (1)

Vehicles with persons standing on the outside thereof, or trucks with persons
sitting on the rear with feet dangling. (2)

Vehicles having flat tires. (3)

Construction vehicles with metal tires, tracks or solid rubber tires. (4)

Pushcarts, wheelbarrows, velocipedes and similar vehicles. Bicycles may be
walked, not ridden, on bridge sidewalks and other walk areas normally provided
for pedestrian traffic. (5)

Vehicles loaded with garbage, papers, loose hay, straw or loose materials not
effectively covered. (6)

Vehicles
loaded with animals or poultry not properly confined. (7)

Vehicles overloaded to such an extent
that the means of propulsion are insufficient. (8)

Vehicles with inadequate
brakes. (9)

Vehicles transporting
explosives and other dangerous materials or articles, unless permitted under
section
950.6
of this Part. (10)

Buses with passengers standing between
the driver and the front entrance door or so located as to obstruct the view of
the driver both front and/or sides. (11)

Vehicles emitting excess smoke or
fumes. (12)

Vehicles exceeding the
following specifications: Rainbow Bridge: Overhead clearance....... 131/2 feet

Maximum vehicle width....... 12 feet

Load limit....... standard loading

Whirlpool Rapids Bridge: Overhead clearance....... 13 feet

Maximum vehicle width....... 13 feet

Load limit....... standard loading

Lewiston-Queenston Bridge: Overhead clearance....... 16 feet 2 inches

Maximum vehicle width....... 12 feet

Load limit....... standard loading

Vehicles desiring to cross Rainbow or Lewiston-Queenston
bridges with loads of 50 tons or over, and to cross Whirlpool Rapids Bridge
with loads over 40 tons, and exceeding the limits as to width or overhead
clearances above set forth, must obtain special permission from the commission
for such crossing under such terms and conditions as the commission in its sole
discretion shall prescribe. The commission reserves the right to determine
whether any vehicle is of unusual or unconventional design, weight or
construction. (13)

Other
vehicles which in the sole and exclusive judgment of the bridge employee in
charge of the facility, are likely to delay traffic unreasonably, damage the
facility or endanger persons or property. (b) All vehicles. Before using any portion of the facilities, all vehicles
shall be subject to inspection when, in the opinion of the bridge employee then
in charge, such inspection shall be deemed necessary to determine whether such
use would be in violation of these rules and regulations, and if in the sole
and exclusive judgment of the bridge employee in charge a vehicle is determined
to be unsafe then the transportation of such vehicle shall be
prohibited. Notes
